SyncLog.title: SyncLog
SyncLog.description: Represents a synchronization event between Firebase and the local MySQL database.

id.description: Unique identifier for the synchronization log entry.

firebaseCollection.description: The name of the Firebase collection that was synchronized.

mysqlTable.description: The name of the MySQL table that was synchronized.

syncDirection.description: The direction of the synchronization (e.g., Firebase to MySQL, MySQL to Firebase).

syncTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the synchronization occurred.

status.description: The status of the synchronization (e.g., success, failure, pending).

details.description: Detailed information about the synchronization process, including any errors or warnings.

AdminReview.title: AdminReview
AdminReview.description: Represents an admin's review of a proposed synchronization event.

id.description: Unique identifier for the admin review entry.

syncLogId.description: Reference to the SyncLog entity. (Relationship: SyncLog 1:N AdminReview)

reviewTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the review was performed.

decision.description: The admin's decision on the synchronization (e.g., approve, reject).

justification.description: The admin's justification for their decision, potentially generated by an LLM.

adminId.description: Reference to the Admin entity. (Relationship: Admin 1:N AdminReview)

Admin.title: Admin
Admin.description: Represents an administrator user with access to the synchronization approval tool.

id.description: Unique identifier for the administrator user.

email.description: The email address of the administrator.

firstName.description: The first name of the administrator.

lastName.description: The last name of the administrator.

definition.description: Stores synchronization logs.  Admin roles (roles_admin/{uid}) determine who can read and potentially trigger synchronization actions.

params.name: syncLogId
params.description: The unique ID of the synchronization log.

definition.description: Stores admin reviews of synchronization logs.  Each review is linked to a sync log via `syncLogId` and an admin via `adminId`. Includes denormalized 'adminId' for authorization independence.

params.name: adminReviewId
params.description: The unique ID of the admin review.

definition.description: Stores administrator user profiles.  This collection holds user data; access control is based on the user's ID.

params.name: adminId
params.description: The unique ID of the administrator user.

definition.description: This collection exists to represent admin roles, using 'existence over content'.  If a document exists for a user ID in this collection, that user is considered an admin.

params.name: adminId
params.description: The unique ID of the administrator user.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the synchronization of data between Firebase and a local MySQL database, focusing on admin review and approval before synchronization. The structure prioritizes authorization independence, clarity, and security. It leverages structural segregation to ensure that documents within a collection share the same security requirements, and path-based ownership for private user data. The Admin entity and AdminReview entities are used to provide an extra layer of control, so data stored on MySQL is not blindly synced. The structure will enable list operations and maintains the integrity of ownership.
